content:
I seem to remember from the live demonstration in the lecture that one could simply write by h1 instead of by rw[h1] if the first line of the proof was simply restating the hypothesis. However, when I try this locally, Lean seems to disagree. Why is this so?
image.png

h3 is a term (it's a proof). by switches from term mode to tactic mode, so by h3 definitely won't work because h3 is not a tactic. But if you just drop by then you'll stay in term mode and then h3 should work because it's the right term needed to prove the result you want.
Ahhh I see, that makes perfect sense. Thanks
Akshay Shankar has marked this topic as resolved.
